column2: Number and percentage of public school male students with and without disabilities subjected to mechanical restraint, by race/ethnicity, whether with disabilities served under IDEA or Section 504, and English proficiency, by state: School Year 2013-14

column18: Students With Disabilities Served Under IDEA
column20: Students With Disabilities Served Only Under Section 504

column8: Hispanic or Latino of any race
column14: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

column2: NOTE: Table reads (for US Totals):  Of all 4,499 public school male students subjected to mechanical restraint, 60 (1.4%) were American Indian or Alaska Native, 1,472 (93.8%) were students with disabilities served under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA), and 97 (6.2%) were students with disabilities served solely under Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973.
The ‘1-3’ reference indicates that the data have been suppressed based on the schools’ reported n-size, and that the midpoint was used to calculate the total.

SOURCE: U.S. Department of Education, Office for Civil Rights, Civil Rights Data Collection, 2013-14, available at http://ocrdata.ed.gov. Data notes are available on the Data Notes page, under Additional Resources at  http://ocrdata.ed.gov/DataNotes.
